data.title: ContentProcessorContext.BuildAndLoadAsset fails when trying to build .fx files
data.body:
I have a ContentProcessor that dynamically builds an effect file, and then calls `BuildAndLoadAsset` like this:

``` csharp
var tempFxFile = @"C:\Users\Tim\AppData\Local\Temp\DynamicallyGeneratedEffect.fx";
CompiledEffectContent compiledEffect = context.BuildAndLoadAsset<EffectContent, CompiledEffectContent>(
    new ExternalReference<EffectContent>(tempFxFile),
    "EffectProcessor");
```

It works fine in XNA. But in MonoGame, it crashes with this message: "The path is not of a legal form.". Here is the stack trace:

```
mscorlib.dll!System.IO.Path.NormalizePath(string path, bool fullCheck, int maxPathLength, bool expandShortPaths)    Unknown
    mscorlib.dll!System.IO.Path.GetFullPath(string path)    Unknown
    MonoGame.Framework.Content.Pipeline.dll!TwoMGFX.ShaderInfo.FromString(string effectSource, string filePath, TwoMGFX.Options options)    Unknown
    MonoGame.Framework.Content.Pipeline.dll!Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Content.Pipeline.Processors.EffectProcessor.Process(Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Content.Pipeline.Graphics.EffectContent input, Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Content.Pipeline.ContentProcessorContext context)    Unknown
    MonoGame.Framework.Content.Pipeline.dll!Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Content.Pipeline.ContentProcessor<Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Content.Pipeline.Graphics.EffectContent,Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Content.Pipeline.Processors.CompiledEffectContent>.Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Content.Pipeline.IContentProcessor.Process(object input, Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Content.Pipeline.ContentProcessorContext context) Unknown
    MonoGame.Framework.Content.Pipeline.dll!MonoGame.Framework.Content.Pipeline.Builder.PipelineManager.ProcessContent(MonoGame.Framework.Content.Pipeline.Builder.PipelineBuildEvent pipelineEvent)    Unknown
    MonoGame.Framework.Content.Pipeline.dll!MonoGame.Framework.Content.Pipeline.Builder.PipelineProcessorContext.BuildAndLoadAsset<Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Content.Pipeline.Graphics.EffectContent,Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Content.Pipeline.Processors.CompiledEffectContent>(Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Content.Pipeline.ExternalReference<Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Content.Pipeline.Graphics.EffectContent> sourceAsset, string processorName, Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Content.Pipeline.OpaqueDataDictionary processorParameters, string importerName)    Unknown
    MonoGame.Framework.Content.Pipeline.dll!Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Content.Pipeline.ContentProcessorContext.BuildAndLoadAsset<Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Content.Pipeline.Graphics.EffectContent,Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Content.Pipeline.Processors.CompiledEffectContent>(Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Content.Pipeline.ExternalReference<Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Content.Pipeline.Graphics.EffectContent> sourceAsset, string processorName)    Unknown
    Apollo.Content.Pipeline.dll!Apollo.Content.Pipeline.Processors.ShaderProcessor.Process(Apollo.Content.Pipeline.Graphics.ShaderContent input, Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Content.Pipeline.ContentProcessorContext context) Line 24  C#
    MonoGame.Framework.Content.Pipeline.dll!Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Content.Pipeline.ContentProcessor<Apollo.Content.Pipeline.Graphics.ShaderContent,Apollo.Content.Pipeline.Graphics.CompiledShaderContent>.Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Content.Pipeline.IContentProcessor.Process(object input, Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Content.Pipeline.ContentProcessorContext context) Unknown
    MonoGame.Framework.Content.Pipeline.dll!MonoGame.Framework.Content.Pipeline.Builder.PipelineManager.ProcessContent(MonoGame.Framework.Content.Pipeline.Builder.PipelineBuildEvent pipelineEvent)    Unknown
    MonoGame.Framework.Content.Pipeline.dll!MonoGame.Framework.Content.Pipeline.Builder.PipelineManager.BuildContent(MonoGame.Framework.Content.Pipeline.Builder.PipelineBuildEvent pipelineEvent, MonoGame.Framework.Content.Pipeline.Builder.PipelineBuildEvent cachedEvent, string eventFilepath)    Unknown
    MonoGame.Framework.Content.Pipeline.dll!MonoGame.Framework.Content.Pipeline.Builder.PipelineManager.BuildContent(string sourceFilepath, string outputFilepath, string importerName, string processorName, Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Content.Pipeline.OpaqueDataDictionary processorParameters)    Unknown
    MGCB.exe!MGCB.BuildContent.Build(out int successCount, out int errorCount)  Unknown
    MGCB.exe!MGCB.Program.Main(string[] args)   Unknown

```

I've debugged it, and found that `options.OutputFile` is an empty string, which causes the crash in ShaderInfo.cs:L81.

The root of the problem seems to be that in `PipelineProcessorContext.BuildAndLoadAsset`, it creates a `PipelineBuildEvent` but doesn't set `DestFile` to anything.

data.title: Plane improvements
data.body:
I've implemented the missing Plane.Transform methods, to transform a `Plane` by a `Matrix` and a `Quaternion`.

(I think this is my first pull request to MonoGame!)

data.title: Gtk Pipeline Multiselect
data.body:
Things added:
  • Ability to select folders
  • Full multiselect support
  • Mimicking #3324
With this PR the gtk pipeline is finally at equal position with the windows pipeline.

data.title: Viewport improvements
data.body:
Changes : 
  -Comments for all things inside Viewport struct.
  -New constructor which accept full Viewport description.
  -Change TitleSafeArea a bit.(I still thinks that is subject to change for platforms like PS4 or XBOX)

PS If this change is not correct I remove it quickly.

data.title: Gtk Pipeline Update
data.body:
Changed Stuff:
  • You can use up and down arrows to go threw the projectview
  • Autoloads last open project on startup
  • Asks exit question when the window X button is clicked.
  • Propertygrid design change
  • Ability to sort items by name and group in propertiesgrid
  • Collection and color dialogs
  • Added better tracking of when something is changed in propertiesgrid
  • Added "build action" as an option.

data.title: iOS: robust rotation handling for iPad/iPhone devices
data.body:
- Should address issue raised by #3271
- In particular, both iPad/iPhone devices should correctly autorotate
- The main problem was that previously, iPad devices would not receive TraitCollectionDidChange calls after a rotation, so this is an alternate solution

data.body:
Should we add VS F# templates as part of the normal Windows installer package?

How many platforms do we add F# templates for?  All the ones we have C# templates?

data.title: Improved WinRT MediaLibrary load
data.body: It now uses async/await everywhere internally. However, it's still really slow due to the async IO overhead.

data.title: Android album art improvement
data.body:
Enable filtering when resizing album art on Android. It yields better results:
https://dl.dropboxusercontent.com/u/18446310/filter_parameter_example.png

data.title: Improve FBX support
data.body:
I have spent some time refactoring the OpenAssetImporter. The goal was to improve FBX support. If a model can be previewed in the [Assimp viewer](http://assimp.sourceforge.net/main_viewer.html), then MonoGame should be able to import it.

Still, there are tons of FBX models that Assimp does not support. I think this is the best we can do in MonoGame, everything else needs to be fixed in Assimp.

**DISCLAIMER:** I have mostly tested the FBX importer with our custom model processor. Our model processor now works with the XNA content pipeline and the MonoGame content pipeline (same code).
Please test your models with MonoGame's ModelProcessor!

**Notes about XNA vs. MonoGame/Assimp:**
XNA was built with the 2006.11 version of the FBX exporter. It may or may not support newer FBX versions. This is totally unpredictable. It depends on the internal structure of the FBX file -- the actual file version is secondary.

Assimp supports FBX version 7.1 (FBX 2011), 7.2 (FBX 2012), and 7.3 (FBX 2013). That means most original XNA models need to be converted to a newer version.
Assimp is not as powerful as the FBX SDK. It is best to check each FBX file in the [Assimp viewer](http://assimp.sourceforge.net/main_viewer.html). If the model does not look right in the viewer, then it can't be imported with MonoGame. The model needs to be fixed in 3dsmax (or another tool).

For example: The XNA's Dude.fbx from the [SkinningSample](http://xbox.create.msdn.com/en-US/education/catalog/sample/skinned_model) needs to be converted to a newer FBX version. But even then it can't be loaded by Assimp. We had to fix pivots/transforms and animations manually in 3dsmax.

data.title: Fix for building external references
data.body:
A few changes were required to build my existing XNA content.

`ContentProcessorContext.BuildAndLoadAsset` can be called with `processorName = null`. In this case XNA imports the asset, but does not process it. This is for example used in http://blogs.msdn.com/b/shawnhar/archive/2010/06/18/merging-animation-files.aspx.

`ContentProcessorContext.BuildAsset` does not yet generate automatic names, such as "AssetName_i". The name is currently hardcoded as "AssetName_0". But in our content project, we have multiple multiple assets with the same name. For example: a model "House.fbx" uses a material "House.drmat", which references a texture "House.tga". In this case MGCB should create "House.xnb", "House_0.xnb", "House_1.xnb". 
A texture "House.tga" may be referenced by multiple materials. Sometimes "House.tga" needs to be processed multiple times with different settings. In this case multiple files need to be created ("House_1.xnb", House_2.xnb", "House_3.xnb"). When the "House.tga" is processed multiple times with the same settings, the file should be reused (create only "House_1.xnb").
I have added the necessary changes. All PipelineBuildEvents are now tracked in a dictionary. When a new asset is build, asset name and processor parameters are compared with the previous pipeline build events.

While working through the code I repeatedly got confused by "Dependencies" vs. "BuildAsset" vs. "BuildOutput" and how they relate to the XNA pipeline. I have added some code comments.

If you need more info, let me know. I have tested the new MGCB on a fairly large and complex content project.

data.title: Window.AllowUserResizing = false; has no effect on Linux
data.body: A window is always resizable on Linux, regardless of the setting in Window.AllowUserResizing, regardless of where in the Game it's set.

data.title: Add TextureCubeWriter and fix for ExternalReference
data.body:
In our game engine we create and write `TextureCube` via the content pipeline.

Changes:
- `TextureCubeWriter` added. Creates same output as in XNA.
- `Texture2DWriter` changed to match `TextureCubeWriter`. (Unnecessary comment/calculation removed. Output is the same as before.)

Plus, here is a fix for external references:
When an `ExternalReference<TextureContent>` is stored in a `Dictionary<string, object>` it can't be loaded at runtime. The reason is that the dictionary values are written with the `ReflectiveWriter<object>`. The `ReflectiveWriter<object>` writes `"ExternalReferenceReader'1[[TextureContent]]"` as the runtime reader.
But `"ExternalReferenceReader'1[[TextureContent]]"` does not exist. The runtime reader needs to be `"ExternalReferenceReader"`.

The following changes solve the problem:
- `ExternalReferenceWriter<T>` needs to override GetRuntimeReader and GetRuntimeType.
- `TextureWriter` needs to be added. The TextureWriter is never used to write anything. It is however used when an `ExternalReference<TextureContent>` is written.

data.title: Fix for MeshHelper.CalculateNormals
data.body: `MeshHelper.CalculateNormals` fails if the "Normal" channel does not already exist. The reason is that `VerexChannelCollection.Get<T>(string)` throws an `ArgumentException` if the channel is missing. It does not return null as expected.

data.title: Fix MeshHelper.TransformScene()
Vertex channel conversion
data.body:
In the XNA content pipeline vertex colors are usually imported as `VertexChannel<Vector4>`.
In the MonoGame content pipeline vertex colors seem to be imported as `VertexChannel<Color>`.
That's just a minor difference - no problem so far.

When the mesh is processed in my custom model processor, I call 

```
geometryContent.Vertices.Channels.ConvertChannelContent<Color>(colorChannelIndex);
```

This call fails in MonoGame because `VertexChannel<Color>` cannot be converted to `VertexChannel<Color>`. This commit adds support for this trivial case.

data.title: Fix: Creation of ContentTypeReader fails on Android
data.body: ContentTypeReaderManager.LoadAssetReaders() uses Type.GetType(string) to resolve the ContentTypeReader. Type.GetType(string) can fail on Android when the string contains spaces.

data.title: Fix: ContentIdentity of Texture2DContent is not set.
data.body: The ContentIdentity should be set by the TextureImporter. The ContentIdentity is needed to create proper error messages in the content processor.

data.title: Make PvrtcBitmapContent public
data.body:
PvrtcBitmapContent should have the same visibility as Dxt1BitmapContent, Dxt3BitmapContent, etc.
Third-party libraries need to be able to create a PvrtcBitmapContent.

data.title: Fix for derived content importers
data.body:
Content importers derived from an existing content importer do not work.

For example:

```
class MyTextureImporter : TextureImporter { }
```

This fails because PipelineTypes.Load() only goes up one level in the inheritance hierarchy and reads the generic argument. But in the example above, TextureImporter does not have generic arguments.

data.title: Fix for BoneWeightCollection.NormalizeWeights
data.body: BoneWeightCollection.NormalizeWeights has no effect. The operations are performed on a temporary list instead of the internal list. (And the lamda can be shortened.)

data.title: Make context menu appear when the Menu key is pressed on the keyboard.
data.body:
This fixes issue #3323.

A couple notes:
- When I tested this on my machine, the Keys.Apps key was used when I pressed the Menu key on my keyboard. I assume this will work for other users, since going by these docs (http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/system.windows.forms.keys%28v=vs.110%29.aspx), Keys.Menu is actually referring to the ALT key.
- I moved most of the common logic into a TreeViewShowContextMenu() method, which I think should work. Let me know if this or anything else needs to be changed.

data.title: Pipeline tool - display context menu in project pane when right-click keyboard key is pressed
data.body:
Expected behavior:
In the project structure pane, the user presses the keyboard's right-click button (this one: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Menu_key) and the context menu specific to the selected node appears.

Actual behavior:
The user presses the keyboard's right-click button and nothing happens.

data.title: Pipeline tool - add indicator for missing files.
data.body:
It would be useful to add an indicator that a file does not exist in the project structure pane when the Pipeline tool can't find a file

For example:
If I have this project structure:
Models\
    ModelA
    ModelB

and I then move all the files into a new folder like so:
Models2\
    ModelA
    ModelB

it would be useful if a little red circle showed in the Pipeline UI, indicating that the tool can't find the file. Not sure how tricky this would be to implement, but it would just be a nice-to-have thing - not super high priority I wouldn't think.

data.title: Use nugets packages for SharpDX
data.body: Please start using the nugets packages for SharpDX to simplify compilation of MonoGame, or add instruction on how to compile MonoGame.
